title: 105_hr2366
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1997" authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct the Census of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to conduct a census of agriculture every fifth year, collecting information from the previous year. Enforcement includes fines for providing false answers or refusing to answer questions. The census conducted by the Secretary of Agriculture collects information every fifth year, with fines for refusing to answer questions or providing false answers. Individuals who refuse to answer census questions may be fined up to $100, but are not required to disclose their Social Security number or religious beliefs. The census includes all states and, as determined appropriate, the District of Columbia. The Secretary of Agriculture conducts a census every fifth year, with fines for non-compliance. The census includes all states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Northern Mariana Islands, the US Virgin Islands, and Guam. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information collected under Title 13, US Code, to the Secretary of Agriculture upon request. The Secretary of Agriculture may provide census information to the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes only. Regulations for this section can be issued by the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture can share census data with the Secretary of Commerce for statistical purposes. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, is repealed, and clerical amendments are made to Subchapter II of chapter 5, changing the subchapter heading to "POPULATION, HOUSING, AND UNEMPLOYMENT." The analysis of chapter 5 is also updated accordingly. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, is repealed, and clerical amendments are made to Subchapter II of chapter 5, changing the subchapter heading to "POPULATION, HOUSING, AND UNEMPLOYMENT." The amendment to Section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act removes a specific reference. The effective date for these changes is October 1, 1998. The curr_chunk discusses amending sections of the Food Security Act of 1985 to include information provided to the Secretary of Agriculture and Secretary of Commerce under the Census of Agriculture Act of 1997. The curr_chunk states that information can be released to the Secretary of Commerce under the Census of Agriculture Act of 1997, without prohibiting it. The curr_chunk mentions the roles of Speaker of the House of Representatives and Vice President of the United States.
